title: Lowest F-gases Emissions from Industrial Processes
description: In 2023, Zambia reported F-gases emissions from industrial processes at just 0.0001 Mt CO2e, one of the lowest in the world.

title: Lowest Risk Premium on Lending
description: In 2020, Zambia had a risk premium on lending of -11.32%, indicating a negative spread between lending rates and treasury bill rates, one of the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Proportion of Population Spending Over 25% on Health Care
description: In 2015, only 0.01% of Zambia's population spent more than 25% of their household consumption or income on out-of-pocket health care, one of the lowest rates worldwide.

title: Highest Learning Poverty Rate
description: In 2019, 98.5% of children at the end of primary age in Zambia were below minimum reading proficiency, adjusted for out-of-school children, one of the highest rates in the world.

title: Highest Pupils Below Minimum Reading Proficiency
description: In 2019, 98.24% of pupils in Zambia were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, using the low GAML threshold, one of the highest globally.

title: Highest Vitamin A Supplementation Coverage
description: In 2022, Zambia achieved a vitamin A supplementation coverage rate of 97% among children aged 6-59 months, one of the highest in the world.
